title: UTF-8
summary: UTF-8 (UCS Transformation Format 8) is the World Wide Web's most common character encoding. Each character is represented by one to four bytes. UTF-8 is backward-compatible with ASCII and can represent any standard Unicode character.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
